Reading articles? Works fine if you've got an internet connection. But editing? Oh well. Edits that you have just made won't show. It appears as if you didn't edit anything. And virtually everything that you do (for example, Special:Watchlist) requires an external web browser. Good job, Wikimeda.

Downright awful user experience.

First, I'm an English teacher myself and studied in the US. I had my native friends test this app out and they didn't even pass. Secondly, a pronunciation app itself is not an equivalent of a complete english learning system or program. It is certainly a key part but only after you already have listening, speaking, vocabulary then there's no actual fluency (not to mention slangs and idioms and real life expressions). YouTube has all the pronunciation tutorials you need for free.

Absolutely useless app. I gave this app another person with beginner English level, and this person read with pauses, mispronounced almost each word, made stress on wrong syllables. And how do you think, what the result of this test was? 80% native speaker! This is silly, this app doesn't work. I see many likes here, but it's because all these people feels themselves a great English speakers (and it is not truth). The only thing that works, you can compare your phrases with native speaker (the app record each your attempt and you can hear yourself). But you can do the same without this app, just use youtube and sound recorder from your phone (and do it for free, without premium subscription, that you need for using of this app).

I must give a warning to everyone who intends to use Elsa. I really had a bad experience when I start using this app, they pop up the free 7 trial days but automatically, it linked with my credit card and set payment without my confirmation. I lost $9 for 3 months and auto renew after 3 months. Although the amount is not much but it made me feel unsafe on what they did. I do not recommend using this app.XXX

Please be aware that the app quietly increased the price of monthly subscription from $3.99 to $11.99 and yearly subscription from $29.99 to $74.99. There used to be frequent offers to get the yearly subscription for as long as $23.99! Also please note that there are frequent price fluctuations, and often the price for the same service can vary right within the app. Right now, I can subscribe for yearly subscription for $74.99, $59.99 or $37.49 simply depending on where you click inside the app.

This app works with some algorithms. If you say wrong any word, you gotta say it more than 10 times. Specially say any word incorrect twice in a row. After that even you will say the word absolutely clearly the algorithm will find a mistake. Even tenth attempt is true, if you will move forward and say the same word twelfth time, it will be a wrong answer. Good app for most of Asian people who don't know the correct pronunciations, after eleventh attempt they'll reach it and feel satisfied.

sounds very American, not good for received pronunciation ð   Update following developer's response: Is even discrimination assuming that everyone is speaking American English.  Last update: Thank you for the response. Teaching American pronunciation is totally fine for whoever is interested on it. The title here in google play however indicates that you support the original English Accent (English originates from England). Finding that this is not the case is confusing to whoever is not interested in American pronunciation in particular. Perhaps you could indicate any particular dialect you support in the tittle and make your application more complete and professional.

First, I'm an English teacher myself and studied in the US. I had my native friends test this app out and they didn't even pass. Secondly, a pronunciation app itself is not an equivalent of a complete english learning system or program. It is certainly a key part but only after you already have listening, speaking, vocabulary then there's no actual fluency (not to mention slangs and idioms and real life expressions). YouTube has all the pronunciation tutorials you need for free.

You have to pay to access a lot of words. As a student without money to spend it's just better for me to use the completely free online version.

I truly love the wikipedia app, but suddenly the crowned feature, the Places tab, is missing from my version. This feature placed nearby articles on an interactive map. EDIT: In response to the developer response below: It was working just fine until the new version. Most new tablet devices capable of running this app are ChromeOS devices and the website is not designed for touch-only interfaces. It's been an integral part of our homeschooling efforts since the schools shut down and I can't side-load the app on my children's FamilyLink google accounts. Now is not the time to be breaking compatibility with students' devices. Please help. ORIGINAL REVIEW: The update (6.10.0) breaks compatibility with some ChromeOS devices. I've been unable to use the app on my son's Acer Chromebook Tab 10, and up until the update that was his primary way of working on his math assignments. We've switch over to the website for now, but it is not nearly as easy to use with a touch interface. Please fix! Other than that, this has been a wonderful app to see grow over the years. I've used Khan Academy with both my children for several years now and they are both excelling in math. Sal Khan is a legend in our house.

I'm currently on a 50+ day streak using Duolingo. I updated today, and it moved me to a new heart based system. Now, if I make enough mistakes, I run out of hearts and am no longer able to learn. The app holds your ability to learn a language hostage as punishment for making mistakes WHEN LEARNING. The desktop version doesn't have these hearts, so I am able to learn from my mistakes and at my own pace. The desktop version works in a mobile browser. This app hinders learning. Go to the website.

Using to learn French for 543 days now, paid nearly $90 just to never see ads(for one year), and not have hearts. Which, if you're trying to use this without paying that good luck. Honestly it's sad, the stuff they've been adding recently is just not good at all. I couldn't care about a "mistakes tab" or having to sit through 3 second clips after the end of a lesson. I'm just trying to get in, learn and get out. The only good update was when they added darkmode, no settings to turn off trash.

I would've given 5 stars until now, but the recent updates suck. I hate the new "heart" mechanic, especially considering that the new content has buggy questions without correct answers. Changing the story mode to be dependent on crowns makes sense, but I'm not sure that I like it. Overall the app is still good, but the updates should probably be more polished before release.

I do not recommend this for people wanting to learn a new language. Not only do you have to get every single word right (which is impossible with some words) but it's also boring. I dread doing my lessons to progress because this app made me lose the drive to learn a new language Update: It's worse now. They tried making it more fun but all it is is absolutely infuriating.

Used to be a great app, and I was happy to tolerate the repeated advertising. The updates since Easter now limit free learning to five errors per session with enforced breaks of hours unless you subscribe. The entire process to this point was based on putting in the time and completing lessons. Now they end half way through if you make too many errors and no further access without paying. Unless you want to pay Â£60/yr or only plan to spend v few minutes per day, pick another free language app.

Issues frequent. 1) fixing problems in courses can take years; 2) updates can erase your daily progress; 3) the speaking characters take a lot of my screen, make the app slow, and can't be turned off; 4) animations after finishing a lesson are slow and can't be skipped or turned off; 5) app kept crashing at final lessons of a course, making it impossible to progress.

This app has hit an all time low, I was getting on well, then suddenly "ran out of lives" now pay lingots or go plus to carry on learning! You earn 1 star for this update, put the app back to how it originally was, I cannot learn being forced to pay money, or get it right first time, with a wait time of 5 hours for 'One' heart/live seriously! #1 top grossing! Very disappointed! Pay for me to learn, or update the 'Lives' system!

I used to love this app and use it daily. There was a new update I assume that made it unusable on my phone. I cannot swap between languages nor can I tap on any lesson. I have no clue what 1/2 equipped does versus 2/2. Please test your new features before releasing.

This app used to be great, now you have lives and when you're out you need to refill or wait. Sometimes it takes 2 lives for a mistake. Good app but the grammar and vocab rules and advice they give is really minimal. Also, it seems fundamentally flawed that you are tested on words before they tell what they are. Good app but the update is terrible. Stop trying to make the app for preschoolers. It is mostly teens and adults who use this regularly.
Since the most recent update, this app is in full screen mode, hiding the nav bar, by default. It's really annoying me. Please stop it or allow the option to stop it.

Used to be a brilliant app. The hearts system is terrible and means you can't finish the harder lessons without paying for it. Big mistake that will result in many lost users if not corrected. Update: I was hoping to get used to the hearts system but it just punishes you for making mistakes. I learn by making mistakes over and over. This system means I have to wait a day to practice the new content again or change focus onto other content to regain hearts.

Just restarted using this app, loved it before and had contemplated paying for the "pro" subscription. But with the update, they give you a limited number of "wrong answers." If you deplete this limit and don't purchase more, the lesson automatically terminates making you start over. This is a user pain point. I used to recommend this app to everyone looking to start a new language, mostly because the app was fun and seemed to pride itself in helping people learn over making a PROFIT. No more.
I've been using this app for over a year (433 day streak), but it seems like every new update makes it harder to learn, not easier.

Everytime something new is implemented it's effectively useless or negativly impacts the user experience. After losing a ton of progress with a major update, distracting little characters were added with speech bubbles that don't match the narrator, as if this is catered to 5 year olds. Now the app will give you a chance to 'double' your XP on an exercise by taking a more difficult lesson. What it failed to say was there is no streak bonus, so if you do well, it actually does not double the XP.

makes learning impossible. everything has been updated to make it completely unusable to learn unless you have duolinguo plus. every simple mistake is penalized. it prides itself on being a replacement for school classes but I don't ever remember a school lesson kicking me out for missing too many answers to tell me I need to pay money to get the premium experience. I used to love this app and it made me excited to study Spanish. now I dread it in case I miss too many questions. this app sucks.

I used to love this app but the new blue gems and the heart system are horrible. The gems used to mean something but now the amount you earn is disproportionate to the amount you have to spend so they are worthless. And the hearts mean you are getting penalized instead of learning from mistakes. It's just not fun or useful anymore. Update: No change, the system just feels like a Money-grab now. I actually actively recommend people not to get it, you will not learn unless you pay. Don't bother.

The updated version stinks! It was a good app before that. Now it constantly glitches and freezes on every other phrase on all the devices I've tried learning on. It also keeps kicking me out of lessons making it impossible for keeping my score up. As something I use to look forward to use on the daily I'm deeply upset that this update is prohibiting me from learning.

Been using this app for a year now learning Russian. I love the course. I have my issues with the way duolingo teaches, but if you make an effort is an amazing tool. All that said, the new hearts system they have introduced is a real kick in the balls. It's absolutely terrible and makes the app basically useless unless you pay. If you haven't yet chosen a language app, PICK ANOTHER. Unless they get rid of the hearts system DO NOT USE THIS APP. Update: they still haven't fixed it. Unusable.

I use to love this app so much, could spend all day learning languages. Now with the new heart system I am punished for getting incorrect answers. Learning languages thrives on repetition and having to wait hours for the hearts to build back up is useless. Fingers crossed this update is reversed!

With all due respect, could you fix your damn servers already? Connection issues appear on a daily basis. Every other app on my phone works fine. Problems happen only in Duolingo. Update: it's been almost a week and the problem is still there. Judging by other reviews, thousands of other people experience the same problem. You've built a company that's worth billions but still can't solve basic issues. Right. You're probably just too busy pushing people to buy premium accounts. Great work.

I used to love this app but the latest update has made it almost impossible to use without paying. Yes, I agree that software developers need to be paid for their work, but with the amount of advertising we're bombarded with between lessons and 100M+ installs I don't believe any payment is warranted. I use the app to study 11 languages, ranging in level from absolute beginner to almost expert, but my frustration since the last update has me on the verge of uninstalling it. Please remove the idiotic "innovation" of only allowing 5 mistakes per day (for someone who only has time to use the app in the evening the fact that the hearts slowly build up again over a period of hours is useless) and give your enormous user base reason to continue using this app Update April 2021: Not only do they continue to use the stupid points system, but the software is now full of bugs. I got a perfect score on the final checkpoint for the French course, only to see the points I gained disappear, even though the system says I finished the checkpoint. Most days I have to cut my studying short because I run out hearts - it's no use trying to push myself, as the extra effort is penalised instead of rewarded. Message to the geniuses responsible for this idiocy if you were minimally intelligent you would understand that by getting people to complete more lessons they would also be watching more adverts. I guess some concepts are too hard for you to grasp...

Duolingo used to be my go to for learning a language but the new update is terrible. The lives take away the purpose of self paced learning, the stories are a good addition, but the content in the lessons is terrible. It is very repetitive of useless phrases. There is not enough focus on grammar or spelling and many of the questions are multiple choice meaning you don't actually learn anything. The voices are computer generated and it doesn't pick up on pronunciation. Btw I am learning french.

Duolingo used to be my go to free way of learning, however since re-downloading and losing hearts thereby losing progress for making mistakes, I've been completely thrown off and am gonna find an alternative. It was great at first with potential, but each update is getting worse. Not tablet friendly. Updates are buggy. Heart system impedes learning. I understand you need ads to get revenue but it's getting out of control. Some of them are just sleazy. Keeps saying I am offline even if I am connected to the Internet.

Decent app, have used it for years. The latest update however punishes users for mistakes, taking away "lives" until you pay with gems (once you run out, then you have to pay real money) or join their premium service, which you pay for with real money. Im very disappointed greed has ruined another good app. Will be looking for something new (and FREE!)
Since the last update I haven't been able to switch languages or do anything on the app it's totally broken for me now

So far easy to use. You choose your own pace, you can get away with 15 mins a day for when you don't have a lot of time the lessons aren't long. When you have more time you can knock out a whole section. What I really love is that the lessons aren't overly repetitive. Terrible. Upgraded to "Plus" and lost all my progress, had to start over from the beginning. I've tried to contact support and heard nothing. All updates have been garbage. The Japanese update was more hiragana & katakana. Seriously?! After all that hype about revamping it?? The heart system has significantly brought down my active time. I only use it to keep my streak and still miss days. And the new characters' faces look so disgusted and angry when an answer is wrong! Can we please have Duo back at least? At least as an option?

I already gave the app 2 stars in my last review and it just gets worse. There is too much latency since the last update; some of the selections don't work and I get incorrect answers. Also, the answers that are close to the original essence/context of the sentence/phrase is considered incorrect that I had to fact check with native speakers to actually check if I was really wrong. And the bots within the app are not being addressed at all.

One of the worst apps it's has been very glitchy since the last update the characters don't move,it marks my correct answers wrong tbh If you have an Android version 6 and lower don't download this stupid app. And to fix this glitchiness I cleared out every bit of storage for this to work but it just doesn't work. I'll just stick with lingodeer.

Upd: The app keeps switching to offline even though there are no connection issues. The update didn't help. _ Hey Duo, here's the thing. As much as I enjoy your lessons, the loud and obnoxious ads is the one and only reason why I'll never pay for Plus. I'm not supporting your devs who don't mind blasting full-volume ads at the unsuspecting non-paying users who just finished a lesson with listening exercises. It'd be great if you could drop them a hint that perhaps it's not such a good idea.

I'm sad that it was updated so that now you can only mess up five times before having to spend your lingots on more hearts to continue to learn that language. Or you have to pay for the full app to have unlimited hearts. This was the one cool language app and everyone knew that, but they ruined that and I'm so disappointed.

This app was ok before, but never updated in a meaningful way. Then they tried to "gamify" it too much and now it's just garbage. My favorite part is how you can now pay 200 gems to try to skip a level, but are only awarded 6 gems if you pass (/s). I already feel bad enough competing with people who have more time and knock me down every week. On top of this the thirsty ads and incessant popups for Duo+ are gross. One star though for improving Japanese with the new Hiragana/Katakana tab tho.

This app is indeed a useful one. However, a matter of regret that the app didn't include all spoken language in the world. Like, I am a Bengali speaker. 'What language do you speak ' didn't mention about Bengali language. Being a Bengali speaker, I couldn't use the app properly. So it would be better if the app is updated. Waiting for the response. Thank you

One star specifically because of the idiotic heart system. It actively inhibits learning by punishing mistakes, and is a obvious attempt to push people towards the paid app. Until the latest update, I was on the version of the app without hearts, and had been using it for years. Now, I am leaning towards uninstalling and finding another way to learn languages. Update: the number and irritating nature of ads has also increased.

I know that language is a difficult thing for a computer but this app rejects plenty of valid answers. It also fails to specify things like singular or plural in areas where it isn't clear in English (eg "you"). This makes it confusing for knowing the correct translation. This is a pretty irritating app. Apart from the annoying interface, things like updates take ages. I have a good Internet connection (via wifi) and the current update has been running for 3 hours now and is up to 32%.

I'm rating a 1 based on the newest update for the free version. The heart system is terrible. I do my daily lessons with my son, who is more likely to make a mistake for us due to accidently pressing an incorrect button. Being kicked out of a lesson and losing progress is so much more frustrating and does not motivate me to keep going. Challenging a difficult lesson will no longer be enjoyable. Update: it also no longer holds progress if you switch between apps. All lesson progress lost. Awful

They have totally destroyed the experience in this app. As a teacher myself and having used this app for more than a year, the latest updates deter from the fun learning experience offered before. Now you run out of hearts which makes it a harrowing experience and one that is time consuming and demotivating. You can practice to gain hearts but not the skill you keep failing on. Great if you are just getting started but prepare to have your progress staggered and delayed.

This app was supposed to be about free education, but it became corrupted with a recent update. Now the app punishes you for your mistakes and makes it more difficult to keep a streak and keep practicing daily. Buying premium supposedly helps you support free education, but at that point its not free anymore. This was supposed to be and app for education, not a game. People learn by making mistakes, I just hope duolingo learns from theirs.

Before duolingo was updated, there was no hearts. It was more free. I make a mistake and learn. When they added hearts, I would fail most of my lessons and won't have enough money to buy new hearts. Its better to learn duolingo online where there is not hearts and you won't fear making a mistake in a lesson and you can finish a lot more lessons. My dad finishes 25 lessons a day when he does it online. I finish around 10. When I do it on the app, my father does like 5 lesson, and I would do 2.

Going from the best to possiblity worst language learning app with just one update. Not only there is more advertisment than the content, but there is this horrible "hearts" system. You have 5 hearts, and a mistake costs you a heart. Mistakes tolerance has gone down from previous version. And on top of that the hint gives you the WRONG answer. Solution? Buy premium. Blatant cashgrab. Duolingo was never good enough to learn a language, but was at least a good addition. Now it's just horrible.

Learning French. Recently (end Feb 2021 after update) I ran in to problems with a lot of audio examples being quiet. It REALLY REALLY upsets me that if the exercises in a course are updated you lose all of your crowns and progress for those! Needs work, audio all over the place, unintelligible at times. Too many americanisms, cookies? candies? No. Biscuits and sweets/sweeties!! Update, notification settings need improvement. Since their recent update I find myself hating Duolingo! You're not able to make mistakes, you lose "hearts" and are bullied into purchasing more before you can continue your lessons. Loved this app at first. Was fun to learn and seemed to be working. Then in the last update it switched from failing an entire lesson lost a life, to each mistake does. The last update also caused the keyboard to block what you are typing so you cannot proof read your answers. It also is 450 to refil mid lesson vs 350 in store.

I understand trialing new features but this is too much of a difference. Please update android to match the IOS app. This is just too much.

I have used this Duolingo from the start when they only offered a few languages. I was always happy with the application and the friendly nature of the interface, alongside the useful content. However, after using the app for many years, I decided to try out the Duolingo Plus TRIAL to test out the features. After starting the trial, a few days in when I wanted to cancel my trial before being charged, I found that I was unable to do so. I would receive an error message saying no subscription was found.I repeatedly attempted to cancel my subscription to no avail. And today, I was charged for the monthly fee because I was unable to cancel the trail. As a long time user and advocate of Duolingo (over 5 years) I am extremely disappointed and will not recommend this service to anyone at all anymore because of this fraudulent behavior the company has engaged in. A freemium application that encourages users to try out the Duolingo Plus and placing obstacles preventing users from canceling the subscription. As a long-time lover and advocate of Duolingo I am saddened to have to write this review and find it disheartening that the company I love and share with my friends is not what I had thought it to be. I would like to request an immediate refund of the amount charged to my account.
